name: squish
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to crush something that is soft: Don't sit on that bag - you'll squish the sandwiches. Squish the ripe bananas with a potato masher.
More examplesFewer examplesTight shoes squish small toes.The heavy equipment squished the soil,It felt like squishing a grape in your hand.

Related word
squishy
the act or sound of crushing something that is soft: He could hear the squish of the damp ground beneath his boots. If you give the ripe fruit a little squish it will fall apart in your hands.
More examplesFewer examplesThe only sound was the squish of soggy soil under their feet.Hear and feel the crunch of the fresh lettuce and zesty squish of moist tomato.She was repulsed by the smell and the squish of the frog dissection they had to do in class.

Add to word list
Add to word list
to crush something, or to make the sound you make when you walk through something soft and wet: [ I always + adv/prep ] We squished through the mud.
